evidence_span: It should be noted that the initial hydrogen uptake during steam oxidation is very fast (within 10 s). Most of the hydrogen was absorbed during the first neutron exposure time after switching on the steam flow. A rough comparison with the oxidation kinetics shows that in this time about $7 5 \ %$ of the hydrogen produced by the steam oxidation is absorbed.

source_id: STP1529-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_16th Volume_011_chunk67
evidence_span: In Zry-4 the hydrogen uptake starts at $1 0 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ with the fast absorption as reported for $\mathbf { Z } \mathbf { I } \mathbf { R } \mathbf { L } \mathbf { O } ^ { \mathrm { { T M } } }$ at $1 1 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ and a slight decrease of the hydrogen concentration after short time. After about $1 8 0 0 \ s$ the breakaway effect occurs and the hydrogen concentration in the sample increases by a factor of 7 to 8.
